page.title: 08Religion in Trefriw 2
page.content: Churches. The Catholic Church of St. Mary and St. Winifred was built in l964 on the site of a previous church. Two services are held each week. On Sunday an average forty people attend for worship, and on Wednesday morning an average attendance is six. Three churches in the area are under the care of one priest. St. Mary's Church in Wales was built in l23O by Prince Llewellyn though no part of the original buiding remains, except possibly part of the south wall. A service is held each Sunday at 9.3O.a.m., with a congregation of twenty to twenty-five. The roof of the church needs repair, and it is hoped to raise the necessary fifteen thousand pounds by special voluntary efforts.
